contextId.information: Wool and snow are examples of things that are very white. The repetition of "as white as" emphasizes that they were very white. W(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: His head and hair were as white as woolâ€”as white as snow

contextId.information: These two words mean about the same thing and are repeated for emphasis. AT: "for all eternity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These words have similar meanings and are used for emphasis. AT: "something that greatly amazed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
